verses.roman:
yāṅhāra prasāde ei tamo haya nāśa
tamo nāśa kari' kare tattvera prakāśa

synonyms: yāṅhāra—whose; prasāde—by the grace; ei—this; tamaḥ—darkness; haya—is; nāśa—destroyed; tamaḥ—darkness; nāśa—destruction; kari'-doing; kare—does; tattvera—of the truth; prakāśa—discovery.
translation: By the grace of Lord Caitanya and Lord Nityānanda, this darkness of ignorance is removed, and the truth is brought to light.
